overall: Tracheostomy is a surgical procedure that involves creating an opening in the neck to access the trachea. It is often performed in patients who require long-term mechanical ventilation or have upper airway obstruction. Tracheostomy reduces dead space, which is the volume of air that is inhaled but does not participate in gas exchange. This is achieved by bypassing the upper airway, which is the anatomical dead space, and reducing airflow resistance. As a result, tracheostomy increases the efficiency of gas exchange by improving the ventilation-perfusion (V/Q) ratio.

overall: Oxidative phosphorylation is the process by which energy is generated in the mitochondria of cells. It involves the transfer of electrons from NADH and FADH2 to oxygen through a series of electron carriers, which generates a proton gradient across the inner mitochondrial membrane. This proton gradient is then used to drive the synthesis of ATP through the action of ATP synthase.
